result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E Taylor Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500 fine plus court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
--------------------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
--------------------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Defendant will not request early termination.

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
--------------------------------------------

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert E Taylor Jr. in court.  Attorney Stephen Michael Govin in court for Robert E Taylor Jr. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation, firearm possession and voting ineligibility. Minutes filed.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

3:51 PM Defendant Robert E Taylor Jr. in court.  Attorney ADA Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

State is requesting time to prepare Information.
